sections.title: Introduction & Context
sections.goal: Establish interviewee's familiarity with Titan DR project, role in recent drills, and alignment with company values.
sample_questions: Can you briefly describe your role in the Titan DR drills?
How does the 'Safety First' value play into your decision-making during a failover?
Which runbooks or SLAs are most critical during a DR event?

sections.title: Runbook Execution & Incident Response
sections.goal: Understand the interviewee's approach to executing RB-DR-001 and handling deviations under pressure.
sample_questions: Walk me through how you executed RB-DR-001 during the last GameDay test.
What steps do you take when the reality deviates from the runbook?
How do you coordinate with other teams during a multi-region failover?

sections.title: Cross-System Dependencies
sections.goal: Explore how the SRE identifies and manages dependencies between Titan DR and other systems like Aegis IAM or Nimbus Observability.
sample_questions: How do you ensure IAM policies remain consistent during a failover?
What telemetry from Nimbus Observability is most useful in DR scenarios?
Can you describe a time when a dependency outside Titan DR impacted your RTO?

sections.title: Testing & Continuous Improvement
sections.goal: Assess methods for validating DR readiness and integrating lessons from drills into processes.
sample_questions: How do you use findings from TEST-DR-2025-Q1 to improve runbooks?
What metrics or SLOs do you track post-drill?
How do you balance drill frequency with operational workload?

sections.title: Risk Assessment & Tradeoffs
sections.goal: Evaluate the interviewee's ability to weigh tradeoffs between recovery speed, data consistency, and system stability.
sample_questions: In a real incident, how would you prioritize between RTO and RPO?
What are the risks of an overly aggressive failover?
Can you share an example where you had to choose a slower recovery to reduce blast radius?

sections.title: Closing & Reflection
sections.goal: Summarize insights, confirm understanding of processes, and identify areas for further discussion.
sample_questions: If you could change one thing in our DR process, what would it be?
How do you keep yourself and the team prepared for unexpected DR events?
Any final thoughts on aligning DR strategy with sustainable velocity?
